inclusion.criterion: no chronic medical conditions that result in periodic exacerbations
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: between 18 and 40 years inclusive at the enrollment visit
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: regular menstrual cycles that typically occur every 21-35 days when not using hormonal contraception
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: willing to avoid use of any hormonal or intrauterine contraception until the end of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: request emergency contraception within 72 hours (3 days) after unprotected coitus
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: have a negative urine pregnancy test at time of screening
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: currently pregnant (positive high-sensitivity urine pregnancy test)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: desire to use hormonal systemic contraception within 5 days of study drug use
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 32-year-old obese woman with weight concerns, sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape. She has completed the four square step test in 14 seconds.
